intro: Cheilanthes andina, commonly known as the Andean rock fern, is a perennial fern native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant typically grows on rocky outcrops and in dry, well-drained soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its fronds are usually leathery and have a distinctive, serrated margin. Cheilanthes andina is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in rock gardens and as a houseplant.
